page.title: 13GARB. RECREATION GROUND.
page.content: This has been public land for very many years and has been taken into trusteeship by the Parish Council as a playing field and children's play area. It is in regular use by the local football club and children have swings, slide, climbing apparatus, etc. 1977 saw the building of the {'JUBILEE' PAVILION,}funded by public subscription and a grant from District Council. Built by voluntary labour, it has toilets and an L shaped room with kitchen fitments. The total cost was just under Â£4100. Hire{CHARGES}at Â£1.75 are less than the village hall but space restricts its use to smaller groups. The Recreation Ground Committee is smaller than that of the village hall but manages to do all{MAINTENANCE}and decoration work by periodic working evenings or days .
